global.msg_logoutAndDropDatabase: Do you really want to logout? All local data will be lost.
global.msg_searchTermLengthRequired: Required at least 3 characters for searching.
global.error_message_status_400: Received data does not match the expected format. Please contact your administrator.
global.error_message_status_401: You are not authorized to access data. Please contact your administrator.
global.error_message_status_403: Access to data forbidden. Please contact your administrator.
global.error_message_status_404: Could not access data. Please check your internet connection.
global.error_message_status_405: Using a non allowed method to access data. Please contact your administrator.
global.error_message_status_407: Proxy authentication required. Please contact your administrator.
global.error_message_status_408: Timeout received. Please check your internet connection.
global.error_message_status_415: Returned media type is not supported by this app. Please contact your administrator.
global.error_message_status_500: Remote endpoint reported an internal error. Please contact your administrator.
global.error_message_status_503: Remote endpoint is not available. Please contact your administrator.
global.error_message_status_generic:
Unexpected error. Please contact your administrator.

Details:

sync.lb_cleanUp_confirm: To ensure data integrity, the system will now clean up your local data. Do you want to cancel the cleanup?
sync.msg_popup_sync_to_receive_update: You should sync your Mobile device to receive / update all changes!

home.msg_youDeviceIsOffLineForSynchronization: You can not access to Sync with cloud cause the device is OFF-LINE.
home.msg_youDeviceIsOffLineForMobileReports: You can not access to Mobile Reports cause the device is OFF-LINE.
home.msg_youHaveNotPerformedSyncFor: You have not performed synchronization for
home.msg_toTheInternetToPerformASynchronizati: to the Internet to perform a synchronization.
home.msg_theyHaveCarriedOutOver15DaysNoSync: They have carried out over 15 days no synchronization, please connect to the Internet to perform a synchronization.

jobDetails.msg_save_job_detail_subtitle: Your changes will be lost if you don't save your changes
jobDetails.msg_job_successfully_save: The job has been successfully saved!
jobDetails.msg_error_not_valid_date: This is not a valid date
jobDetails.msg_document_not_available: Document not locally available at the moment. Do you want to download the document now?
jobDetails.msg_document_not_available_offline: Document not locally available at the moment
jobDetails.mgs_not_completed_steps: Job status can't set to completed, because one or more Steps are not completed
jobDetails.msg_no_wps_available: There is no WPS file available for this job.
jobDetails.msg_photo_error: There has been a problem. Your photo was not able to be taken.
jobDetails.mgs_job_still_in_preparation: This job is still in preparation. Please check job details before beginning work.
jobDetails.msg_selected_user_text: This user is already assigned to the job/ step.

thickness.validationFailMessage: Cannot assign a material thickness that is outside the range of the WPS.
thickness.validationWPSRange: The material thickness should be between {{minValue}} and {{maxValue}}
thickness.validationEmptyThicknessMessage: Material Thickness cannot be blank or 0.

steps.msg_you_want_clone: Are you sure you want to clone?
steps.msg_you_want_save: Are you sure you want to save?
steps.msg_step_successfully_save: The step has been successfully saved!
steps.msg_save_step_detail_subtitle: Your changes will be lost if you don't save your changes
steps.msg_checkUserQualification_title: Would you like to assign resource to this step now?
steps.msg_checkUserQualification_template: You have either not assigned a welder or the welder you have assigned is not qualified.
steps.msg_error_length_of_text_field: Please check Examination Standard and Judgement Standard

passwordQuestions.lb_questions_5: 你是在哪个城市遇到你的另一半的?
passwordQuestions.lb_questions_6: 你儿时最喜欢的朋友叫什么名字?
passwordQuestions.lb_questions_7: 你的第一份工作是在哪个城市?

touchID.lb_forwarded_local_login: 您现在将被转到本地登录.

home.txt_jobQueue: "Job Queue" button will bring the user to the "Job Queue" screen providing an overview of all Jobs, job information, job filters and their status.
home.txt_projects: "Projects" button will bring the user to the "Projects" screen providing an overview of all Projects, job completion status and "Search" functionality.
home.txt_reports: "Reports" button will bring the user to the "Reports" screen providing an overview of all "Overdue Items", "Issues and Failures", "Qualifications" and "Machines".

settings.txt_appVersionNumber: "App Version Number" field shows you the installed version of the ISW app on its mobile device.
settings.txt_syncedWithCloud: "Synced with Cloud" field shows you at what date and time data was synchronized between the ISW mobile and web application.
settings.txt_synchronize: "Synchronize" is a manual button to actively synchronize the data between the ISW mobile and web application.
settings.txt_changeMobilePassword: "Change Mobile Password" is a button that allows you to change your password for access to the ISW mobile application. Note that this password does not affect the Salesforce account credentials in any way, but only applies on a local/mobile level.
settings.txt_switchUser: "Switch User" enables you to switch to another user account and redirects you to a  mobile login screen on a particular mobile device. In this newly opened page a new user can log on the app with his/her credentials
settings.txt_logout: "Logout" button will log you out from the ISW mobile application
settings.txt_viewTermsAndConditions: "View Terms and Conditions" button shows the Linde Terms and Conditions of the ISW mobile application

job-queue.txt_completionDate: The "Completion Date" button gives you the possibility to automatically sort the "Job Queue" on the dates of completion in descending order.
job-queue.txt_jobTitle: The "Job Title" button gives you the possibility to automatically sort the "Job Queue" on the titles of the job(s) in alphabetical order
job-queue.txt_project: The "Project" button gives you the possibility to automatically sort the "Job Queue" on the titles of the Projects in alphabetical order
job-queue.txt_search: The "Search" field gives you the possibilty to enter any tag/search term/project name/job name and let the app perform a search throughout the "Job Queue". After confirmation of a search query a list of all results will be presented.
job-queue.txt_filter: The "Filter" Icon will allow you to filter jobs in the "Job Queue" on "Assigned User", "Owner", "Completion Date", "Job status" or "Step Status".

sub_filter.txt_assignedUser: "Assigned User" is the assigned user which can be "Welder" or "Quality Inspector" to one or more Steps related to a Job.
sub_filter.txt_owner: "Owner" is the user who created the Job in ISW.
sub_filter.txt_completionDate: "Completion Date" is the date when the job was completed.
sub_filter.txt_jobStatus: "Job Status" gives the status of a Job, which can be "Failed", "In Preparation", "In Progress", "Issue", "Ready" or "Completed"
sub_filter.txt_stepStatus: "Step Status" gives the status of a Step, which can be "Failed", "In Preparation", "In Progress", "Issue", "Ready" or "Completed"

job-queue.txt_jobOverview: The "Job Overview" gives you the overview on all or filtered "Job Title", its "Project Hierarchy" and the "Job Status"

sub_jobOverview.txt_projectHierarchy: "Project Hierarchy" shows the user to which "Project" or "Sub Project" a Job is related to

jobDetails.txt_fullProjectHierarchy: When selecting the"Full Project Hierarchy", button it wil give you an entire overview on the "Master Project" and all related jobs and steps
jobDetails.txt_jobSteps: When selecting The "Job Steps" button it will give you an entire overview of all "Steps", the status of the "Step", what type of "Step" and who is assigned to this "Step" or this specific "Job"

sub_materials.txt_parentMaterial1: When selecting the "Parent Material 1" Button it will give you an overview of which "Material" is assigned to the "Job", which "Designation", "Group", "Sub-Group", "Thickness", "Batch number" and "ID number".
sub_materials.txt_parentMaterial2: When selecting the "Parent Material 2" Button it will give you an overview of which "Material" is assigned to the "Job", which "Designation", "Group", "Sub-Group", "Thickness", "Batch number" and "ID number".
sub_materials.txt_backingMaterial: When selecting the "Backing Material" Button it will give you an overview of which "Material" is assigned to the "Job", which "Designation", "Group", "Sub-Group", "Thickness", "Batch number" and "ID number".

sub_jobInfo.txt_owner: "Owner" Field shows you who is assigned to the selected "Job"
sub_jobInfo.txt_status: "Status" field shows you the "Status" of the "Job", which can be "Failed", "In Preparation", "In Progress", "Issue", "Ready" or "Completed". When you select the "Status" button, you can alter the "Status" of the selected "Job" and save it.
sub_jobInfo.txt_WPS: "WPS" button gives you the details of the assigned "WPS" to the selected "Job". After selection the application will open an PDF Viewer and show the "WPS" in a pdf file.
sub_jobInfo.txt_completionDate: The "Completion Date" gives you the "Date" upon which the "Job" was/is completed.
sub_jobInfo.txt_massAssignedWelders: The "Mass Assigned Welders" field gives you the name of the Welder that is "Mass assigned" to this "Job".
sub_jobInfo.txt_massAssignedQA: The "Mass Assigned QA" field gives you the name of the Quality Inspector Quality Inspector that is "Mass assigned" to this "Job".
sub_jobInfo.txt_lengthOfWeld: The "Length of Weld" field show you the length of the welder for the selected "Job"
sub_jobInfo.txt_location: The "Location" field gives you information where the selected "Job" will be realised
sub_jobInfo.txt_note: Add a note to your "Job" and save it.

jobDetails.txt_filesUploads: You will find an overview of all attachments for the selected "Job". Attachments can be a technical drawing(s), Photos or other type of files
jobDetails.txt_takePhoto: When you want to take a picture and add this to the selected "Job", click "Take Photo". Photo will be attached to the selected "Job".
jobDetails.txt_saveJob: If you have made any alterations to the selected "Job" and want to save that to the "Job", click "Save Job".

jobSteps.txt_steps: Gives you an overview of all "Steps" and its type assigned to the "Job". The layout of the overview is as follows: First line is "Step Name", second line is "Type of Step" and the third line specifies the "Assigned Welder or QA" and on the gray box gives you the current "Status".
jobSteps.txt_stepName: Is the name of the "Step" assigned to the selected "Job".
jobSteps.txt_typeOfStep: Shows you the types of steps assigned to the selected "Job". Type of steps can only be "Welding Step", "QA Step" or "Process Step".
jobSteps.txt_assignedWelderOrQA: Is the (mass) assigned Welder or Quality Inspector assigned to the selected "Step".
jobSteps.txt_statusOfStep: Displays the current "Status" of the selected step. The option for "Status" here are "Failed", "In Preparation", "In Progress", "Issue", "Ready" or "Completed"

welding-step.txt_assignedUser: Specifies the "Welder" for the "Welding Step" in the selected "Job".
welding-step.txt_stepStatus: Displays the current "Step Status" of the selected step. The option for "Status" here are "Failed", "In Preparation", "In Progress", "Issue", "Ready" or "Completed"
welding-step.txt_number: Displays the unique "Number" for this selected "Step"
welding-step.txt_groupNumber: The Step Group Number can be used to group steps together. For example, you could create groups for Root, Fill, Cap Layers or for Pre-Weld, Weld and Post-Weld steps.
welding-step.txt_note: Add a note to your "Step" and save it.
welding-step.txt_resources: Gives you an overview of the resources that can be assigned to the "Step" or "Steps". After selecting "Resources" a new screen will be opened and gives you the possibility to select a "Welding Machine", Gases, Consumables and "Flux".
welding-step.txt_filesUploads: You will find an overview of all attachments for the selected "Job". Attachments can be a technical drawing(s), Photos or other type of files
welding-step.txt_takePhoto: When you want to take a picture and add this to the selected "Step", click "Take Photo". Photo will be attached to the selected "Step".
welding-step.txt_saveStep: If you have made any changes to the selected "Step" and want to apply those changes, click "Save".
welding-step.txt_cloneStep: If you would like to clone this "Step", Click "Clone Step" and all data from the selected "Step" will be duplicated (Cloned) and will receive a new name based on the current "Step Name" including "(Cloned)".

qa-step.txt_assignedUser: Specifies the "Welder" for the "Welding Step" in the selected "Job".
qa-step.txt_stepStatus: Displays the current "Step Status" of the selected step. The option for "Status" here are "Failed", "In Preparation", "In Progress", "Issue", "Ready" or "Completed"
qa-step.txt_number: Displays the unique "Number" for this selected "Step"
qa-step.txt_groupNumber: The Step Group Number can be used to group steps together. For example, you could create groups for Root, Fill, Cap Layers or for Pre-Weld, Weld and Post-Weld steps.
qa-step.txt_testType: The Test Type show what kind of inspection needs to be carried out.
qa-step.txt_examinationStandard: The Examination Standard shows which standard the examination must follow.
qa-step.txt_judgementStandard: The Judgement Standard shows which standard must be followed when deciding if the weld has passed or failed.
qa-step.txt_faultCode: If the weld inspection fails, the Fault Code field can be used to choose why the inspection has failed. Note: The fault code options are restricted based on what has been chosen for Test Type.
qa-step.txt_testResult: Shows you the "Test Result" of the QA Step.
qa-step.txt_note: Add a note to your "Step" and save it.
qa-step.txt_resources: Gives you an overview of the resources that can be assigned to the "Step" or "Steps". After selecting "Resources" a new screen will be opened and gives you the possibility to select a "Welding Machine", Gases, Consumables and "Flux".
qa-step.txt_filesUploads: You will find an overview of all attachments for the selected "Job". Attachments can be a technical drawing(s), Photos or other type of files
qa-step.txt_takePhoto: When you want to take a picture and add this to the selected "Step", click "Take Photo". Photo will be attached to the selected "Step".
qa-step.txt_saveStep: If you have made any changes to the selected "Step" and want to apply those changes, click "Save".
qa-step.txt_cloneStep: If you would like to clone this "Step", Click "Clone Step" and all data from the selected "Step" will be duplicated (Cloned) and will receive a new name based on the current "Step Name" including "(Cloned)".

resourceList.txt_weldingMachine: Gives you the name/Brand?? Of the welding machine assigned to the "Step". A "Welding Machine" should be assigned manually.If you want to search for a "Welding Machine" select this field and you will be lead to a search page, where you are able to search for any term in the search field. Once you have found the "Welding Machine" you would assign to this "Step", select the machine and you will return to the "Resources" page.
resourceList.txt_gas1: When you select "Gas 1" you will be led to an overview page, providing you all information of the assigned "Gas 1" to the selected "Step". If necessary, you can alter the assigned "Gas 1" and pick a more suitable "Gas 1" for the selected "Step".
resourceList.txt_gas2: When you select "Gas 2" you will be led to an overview page, providing you all information of the assigned "Gas 2" to the selected "Step". If necessary, you can alter the assigned "Gas 2" and pick a more suitable "Gas 2" for the selected "Step".
resourceList.txt_gas3: When you select "Gas 3" you will be led to an overview page, providing you all information of the assigned "Gas 3" to the selected "Step". If necessary, you can alter the assigned "Gas 3" and pick a more suitable "Gas 3" for the selected "Step".
resourceList.txt_consumable1: When you select "Consumable 1" you will be led to an overview page, providing you all information of the assigned "Consumable 1" to the selected "Step". If necessary, you can alter the assigned "Consumable 1" and pick a more suitable "Consumable" for the selected "Step".
resourceList.txt_consumable2: When you select "Consumable 2" you will be led to an overview page, providing you all information of the assigned "Consumable 2" to the selected "Step". If necessary, you can alter the assigned "Gas 2" and pick a more suitable "Gas 2" for the selected "Step".
resourceList.txt_flux: When you select "Flux" you will be led to an overview page, providing you all information of the assigned "Flux" to the selected "Step". If necessary, you can alter the assigned "Flux" and pick a more suitable "Flux" for the selected "Step".

resourceWelding.txt_name: Shows you the name of the Asset assigned to the selected "Step". If you want to search for a different type of Asset for the selected "Step", select this field and you will be lead to a search page, where you are able to search for any Asset in the search field. Once you have found your Asset , select it and click "Apply".
resourceWelding.txt_manufacturer: Shows you the "Manufacturer" of the selected "Asset" for the selected "Step".
resourceWelding.txt_model: Shows you the "Model" of the selected "Asset" for the selected "Step".
resourceWelding.txt_cancel: If you have made any changes to the "Asset" for the selected "Step" and do not want to apply those changes, click "Cancel". You can also click "Cancel" if you want to be led back to the "Step Overview" page.
resourceWelding.txt_apply: If you have made any changes to the "Asset" assigned to the "Step" and want to apply those changes, click "Apply". You be led back to the selected "Step Overview" page as your changes are being saved to the "Step".

resourceGas.txt_name: Shows you the name of the "Gas" assigned to the selected "Step". The "Gas" can be assigned to a "Step" manually or via a "Digital WPS". If you want to search for a different type of "Gas" for the selected "Step" select this field and you will be lead to a search page, where you are able to search for any Gas in the search field. Once you have found your "Gas", select it and click "Apply". The "Gas" is now assigned to the selected "Step" and you can return to the "Resources" page.
resourceGas.txt_manufacturer: Shows you the "Manufacturer" of the selected "Gas" for the selected "Step".
resourceGas.txt_brandName: Shows you the "Name" of the selected "Gas" for the selected "Step".
resourceGas.txt_classification: Shows you the classification of the selected "Gas" for the selected "Step".
resourceGas.txt_designation: Shows you the "Designation" of the selected "Gas" for the selected "Step".
resourceGas.txt_id: Shows you the "ID" of the selected "Gas" for the selected "Step".
resourceGas.txt_cancel: If you have made any changes to "Gas" for the selected "Step" and do not want to apply those changes, click "Cancel". You can also click "Cancel" if you want to be led back to the "Step Overview" page.
resourceGas.txt_apply: If you have made any changes to the "Gas" assigned to the "Step" and want to apply those changes, click "Apply". You be led back to the selected "Step Overview" page as your changes are being saved to the "Step".

resourceConsum.txt_name: Shows you the name of the "Consumable" assigned to the selected "Step". "Consumable" can be assigned to a "Step" manually or via a "Digital WPS". If you want to search for a different type of "Consumable" for the selected "Step" select this field and you will be lead to a search page, where you are able to search for any Consumable in the search field. Once you have found your "Consumable" , select it and click "Apply". The "Consumable" is now assigned to the selected "Step" and you can return to the "Resources" page.
resourceConsum.txt_manufacturer: Shows you the "Manufacturer" of the selected "Consumable" for the selected "Step".
resourceConsum.txt_brandName: Shows you the "Name" of the selected "Consumable" for the selected "Step".
resourceConsum.txt_designation: Shows you the "Designation" of the selected "Consumable" for the selected "Step".
resourceConsum.txt_diameter: Shows you the "Diameter" of the selected "Consumable" for the selected "Step".
resourceConsum.txt_colourCode: Shows you the "Colour Code" of the selected "Consumable" for the selected "Step".
resourceConsum.txt_batchNumber: Shows you the "Batch Number" of the selected "Consumable" for the selected "Step".
resourceConsum.txt_id: Shows you the "ID" of the selected "Consumable" for the selected "Step".
resourceConsum.txt_cancel: If you have made any changes to "Consumable" for the selected "Step" and do not want to apply those changes, click "Cancel". You can also click "Cancel" if you want to be led back to the "Step Overview" page.
resourceConsum.txt_apply: If you have made any changes to the "Consumable" assigned to the "Step" and want to apply those changes, click "Apply". You be led back to the selected "Step Overview" page as your changes are being saved to the "Step".

resourceFlux.txt_name: Shows you the name of the "Flux" assigned to the selected "Step". "Flux" can be assigned to a "Step" manually or via a "Digital WPS".If you want to search for a different type of "Flux" for the selected "Step" select this field and you will be lead to a search page, where you are able to search for any Consumable in the search field. Once you have found your "Consumable" , select it and click "Apply". "Flux" now assigned to the selected "Step" and you can return to the "Resources" page.
resourceFlux.txt_manufacturer: Shows you the "Manufacturer" of the selected "Flux" for the selected "Step".
resourceFlux.txt_brandName: Shows you the "Name" of the selected "Flux" for the selected "Step".
resourceFlux.txt_designation: Shows you the "Designation" of the selected "Flux" for the selected "Step".
resourceFlux.txt_batchNumber: Shows you the "Batch Number" of the selected "Flux" for the selected "Step".
resourceFlux.txt_id: Shows you the "Diameter" of the selected "Flux" for the selected "Step".
resourceFlux.txt_cancel: If you have made any changes to "Flux" for the selected "Step" and do not want to apply those changes, click "Cancel". You can also click "Cancel" if you want to be led back to the "Step Overview" page.
resourceFlux.txt_apply: If you have made any changes to the "Flux" assigned to the "Step" and want to apply those changes, click "Apply". You be led back to the selected "Step Overview" page as your changes are being saved to the "Step".

reports.txt_overdueItems: The "Overdue items" field and button gives you the overview of all "Projects", "Jobs" and "Steps" that are overdue and in which "Status"
reports.txt_issuesAndFailures: The "Issues and Failures" field and button gives you the overview of all "Jobs" and "Steps" that have either failed or experience issues and shows the user when the failure or issue arised
reports.txt_qualifications: The "Qualifications" field and button gives you the overview of all "Qualifications" of a "Welder" or "QA inspector" that are about to expire (less then 60 days) or are already expired
reports.txt_machines: The "Machines" field and button gives you the overview of all "Machines" that are due for maintenance, due date for maintenance has already expired or expiration of their guarantee  period.

reportsOverdue.txt_project: The "Project" button gives you the possibility to automatically sort the "Overdue Items" on the titles of the Projects in alphabetical order
reportsOverdue.txt_jobs: The "Jobs" button gives you the possibility to automatically sort the "Overdue Items" on the titles of the Jobs in alphabetical order
reportsOverdue.txt_steps: The "Steps" button gives you the possibility to automatically sort the "Overdue Items" on the titles of the Steps in alphabetical order

reportsIssues.txt_jobs: The "Jobs" button gives a user the possibility to automatically sort the "Overdue Items" on the titles of the Jobs in alphabetical order
reportsIssues.txt_steps: The "Steps" button gives a user the possibility to automatically sort the "Overdue Items" on the titles of the Steps in alphabetical order

projects.txt_search: The "Search" field gives you the possibilty to enter any tag/search term/project name and let the app perform a search throughout "Projects". After confirmation of a search query a list of all results will be presented.
projects.txt_projects: The "Project Overview" gives you the overview of all or filtered "Projects" based on the search terms used in the "Search" field

materialParent.txt_parentMaterial: Give you the entire overview of the material assigned to the "Job".
materialParent.txt_material: Shows you the either manually or WPS selected "Material" assigned to the "Job". If you would like to alter the type of "Material", click on it and you will be led to a new page and material search function
materialParent.txt_designation: Specifies you the designation of the selected "Material".
materialParent.txt_group: Specifies you the "Group" of the selected "Material".
materialParent.txt_subGroup: Specifies you the "Sub-Group" of the selected "Material".
materialParent.txt_thickness: Specifies you the "Thickness" of the selected "Material".
materialParent.txt_batchNumber: Specifies you the "Batch Number" of the selected "Material".
materialParent.txt_iDNumber: Specifies you the "ID Number" of the selected "Material".
materialParent.txt_cancel: If you have made any changes to the Parent Material assigned to the "Job" and do not want to apply those changes, click "Cancel". You can also click "Cancel" if you want to be led back to the selected Job Overview page.
materialParent.txt_apply: If you have made any changes to the Parent Material assigned to the "Job" and want to apply those changes, click "Apply". You be led back to the selected Job Overview page as your changes are being saved to the "Job".

material.txt_materialSelection: Shows all materials that can be added to the selected "Job"
material.txt_search: Enter any search term in the search field and a combination of matches will be shown'

password.txt_newPassword: A local password allows you to access AVANTO offline and allows multiple users to access their own individual profile on a single device.
password.txt_question: A security question allows you to reset your local password should you ever forget it.
